message.content: is there a good website where I can learn about what Claude can do for creating a personal assistant agent for me? I'd like the learn more about how I can integrate claude into handling my scheduling, work, etc.

Here are the search results for Anthropic Claude personal assistant agent API integration in 2026:

## Key Findings

### Claude Agent SDK
The Claude Agent SDK is a collection of tools that helps developers build powerful agents on top of Claude Code.(no content)The agent harness that powers Claude Code (the Claude Code SDK) can power many other types of agents. To reflect this broader vision, Anthropic renamed the Claude Code SDK to the Claude Agent SDK.

### Personal Assistant Agent Capabilities
Personal assistant agents can help you book travel and manage your calendar, as well as schedule appointments, put together briefs, and more by connecting to your internal data sources and tracking context across applications.

### New API Capabilities (October 2025)
Anthropic announced four new capabilities on the API: the code execution tool, MCP connector, Files API, and the ability to cache prompts for up to one hour. Together with Claude Opus 4 and Sonnet 4, these features enable developers to build agents that execute code for advanced data analysis, connect to external systems through MCP servers, store and access files efficiently across sessions, and maintain context for up to 60 minutes with cost-effective caching.

### Claude Cowork (January 2026)
Anthropic released Cowork on January 12, 2026, a new feature embedded in the Claude Desktop macOS application.(no content)The tool grants users the ability to delegate file management, document generation, and data processing tasks to Claude within designated local folders.(no content)Available as a research preview for Claude Max subscribers ($100-200/month), Cowork represents Anthropic's strategic push beyond developer tools into the mainstream productivity market.

### Pricing in 2026
With Anthropic's release of the Claude 4.5 series in late 2025, Claude Opus 4.5 delivers flagship performance at 67% lower cost than its predecessor, while new optimization features like prompt caching and batch processing can reduce costs by up to 90%.

### Integration Options
- Home Assistant has an integration that adds a conversation agent powered by Anthropic, such as Claude 3.5 Sonnet. Controlling Home Assistant is done by providing the AI access to the Assist API.
- The growing ecosystem of remote MCP servers means you can easily add capabilities to your AI applications without building one-off integrations. You can integrate with any remote MCP server, including those from Zapier and Asana.

### Official Resources
- Anthropic offers a comprehensive video course that teaches developers how to integrate Claude AI into applications using the Anthropic API. The curriculum covers fundamental API operations, advanced prompting techniques, tool integration, and architectural patterns for building AI-powered systems.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.thinking: This is great information. Let me provide the user with the most relevant resources for learning about building a personal assistant agent with Claude.

content.text:
There are several great resources from Anthropic for learning about building personal assistant agents with Claude:

## Official Anthropic Resources

1. **[Building with the Claude API - Anthropic Courses](https://anthropic.skilljar.com/claude-with-the-anthropic-api)** - A comprehensive video course covering API operations, prompting, tool integration, and architectural patterns for building AI-powered systems.

2. **[Building agents with the Claude Agent SDK](https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/building-agents-with-the-claude-agent-sdk)** - Documentation on the Claude Agent SDK, which is specifically designed for building powerful agents on top of Claude.

3. **[New capabilities for building agents on the Anthropic API](https://www.anthropic.com/news/agent-capabilities-api)** - Covers four key capabilities: code execution tool, MCP connector, Files API, and prompt caching. These enable agents that can connect to external systems, store files across sessions, and maintain context.

## For Your Use Case (Scheduling, Work Management)

- **MCP (Model Context Protocol)** allows Claude to connect to external systems. There's integration support for services like Zapier and Asana, which could help with scheduling and workflow automation.

- **[Claude Cowork](https://developer.tenten.co/claude-cowork-anthropic-brings-ai-agent-capabilities-to-non-technical-users)** - A newer feature in Claude Desktop (macOS) that lets you delegate file management, document generation, and data processing tasks. Available for Claude Max subscribers.

- **[Home Assistant Integration](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/anthropic/)** - If you use Home Assistant for automation, there's a direct Claude integration.

## Getting Started

I'd recommend starting with the [Anthropic Courses](https://anthropic.skilljar.com/claude-with-the-anthropic-api) to understand the fundamentals, then exploring the Agent SDK documentation for building your personal assistant.

summary: Claude Personal Assistant Agent Learning Resources
